name: Hotel Davanzati

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I was so lucky because I had just 5min. time to book in internet so I just take Hotel Davanzati... And it was the right decision. The service is really great - price/performance ration was very satifsying for me. Again thanks for the great time and will come back - I hope already in autumn this year. See you!
reviews.title: Hotel Davanzati - the perfect accommodation in Firenze

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Salvatore from Austria
reviews.title: Great Choice
Great service
reviews.text: This is a lovely, clean hotel in a great location. Tommaso and the staff are very very helpful and considerate. We stayed 2 nights with our 3 children (17, 15,11) and had a wonderful time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: This hotel demonstrates that it's the little touches that make all the difference, and it's the service and the extra thought that puts this hotel above some of the much more expensive and plusher hotels we've been to. The welcome and consideration from staff is superb. The rooms are spotless and stylish. We never used the laptop or PS2 (why waste time when you're on holiday???!) but they are nice touches, as is the happy hour.
reviews.title: Fantastic in every way

likes.liked: — Everything - staff, location, laptop, happy hour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a fantastic hotel! I stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of July - I was worried as I was travelling alone however, I needn't have worried. As soon as I arrived I was made to feel so welcome. My room was very spacious and well-equipped (having a laptop was excellent) and had a fantastic bathroom. The happy hour also gave you the opportunity to meet other guests.
reviews.title: Hotel Davanzati is truly #1

likes.disliked: — The stairs up to the elevator

reviews.title: What else can you say...
reviews.text: I booked this hotel because of all the wonderful reviews on this site and was not disappointed. My wife and I stayed here for two nights and loved the hotel and the location. Fabrizio and Tomasso are simply some of the nicest people that we met while in Italy. The hotel was renovated recently and is very clean with a laptop in each room. If you have a choice on where to stay while in Florence then look no further.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed 3 days at Davanzati in July 2007, and it was a great experience since the moment you arrive. A friendly welcome by Tommaso was followed by a great explanation of the hotel and its services, and then he personally guided me to my room and showed it to me and told me everything I needed to know about it.
reviews.title: A great place to stay in Florence

likes.liked: — The hospitality and service attitude in all the staff.
likes.disliked: — The staircase you need to climb to get to the elevator that takes you to the lobby. It is a little inconvenient for elder people.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I had an individual room and it was very comfortable and clean. The internet service works great and I had no problems whatsoever to connect my computer.
reviews.title: Beyond Perfect!

likes.liked: — The enthusiastic, warm staff; location; many comforts (ps 2, laptops)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located really close to the main attractions in Florence, such as the Uffizi Gallery, the Accademia, Piazza de la Signoria, you name it. It also worked great for me to be very close from the Santa Maria Novella train station, as I took a one day trip to Rome.
reviews.title: A Perfect Stay

likes.liked: — everything from staff to location to the room
likes.disliked: — no elevator from street level to hotel entrance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The breakfast in the morning and the happy hour in the evening are something you definitely don't want to miss. The prosecco wine and the bruschetta are excellent and a great refreshment after a day of exploring beautiful Florence, and in the morning the cappuccino is a great way to start the day.
reviews.title: Welcome to Florence!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The flight & 1/2 of stairs is daunting for those of us that live in a home with no stairs, and has no reason is climb stairs. That should not compomise this hotel, you should just be aware. Porter came to the street immediately upon arrival to take luggage to our room and was available to return it to the street on departure. A wonderful family run hotel, Grampa, Father & Son. Your see each of them at one time or another. Our room was more than adequate, rather luxurious and comfortable. Bath & Shower looked brand new. The location is probably one of its greatest assets. You can walk to all the must do sights in ten minutes, or less. ATM directly across the street from the hotel. A daily happy hour complimentary from 5 to 7, more than adequate for predinner muchies. Now this all comes at a price that is probably less than half of the more famous hotels, a very great value that I would recommend to all. (and 10% off for cash)
reviews.title: Once you get past the stairs! ITS WONDERFUL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Selected this hotel from Tripadvisor for a three day stay with my friend Christine from America . It was a fantastic Hotel, great location, spotless well equipped good sized room,great linen and towels. However, the most special aspect of this Hotel is the Customer Service which is well above some 5 star Hotel I have stayed in. From the intial booking by email and the offers to arrange tours ,restaurants etc to making us welcome and helping us with lots issues from arrival to departure Fabrizio and Tommaso were quite fantastic. The happy hour is so charming and sitting sipping wine with the other guest while receiving confirmation and directons to our dinner reservations was a very stress free experience . I can not highly recommend this hotel enough suffice it to say many thanks to Fabrizio,Tommaso and family for a magical stay in Florence and I will certainly return to Hotel Davanzati.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel ,Lives up to reviews and Beyond!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked Hotel Davanzati based on the TripAdvisor reviews and can easily recommend this hotel to would-be travelers. The staff were helpful and courteous. While modern, HD still retains some of its Florentine character. Additionally, every effort has been made to make one's stay comfortable. The room was clean, comfortable and came equipped with a complimentary laptop. HD is in a great location - only a few blocks from the Uffizi, Duomo and Ponte Vecchio. Though we welcomed the exercise, the only potential drawback is the fact that climbing stairs is a prerequisite as there is no ground-level elevator.
reviews.title: Excellent Staff, Accommodations and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a mini suite which was spaceous & comfortable. The hotel offers a high level of technology in each room such as TV's, DVD player, Games Console, Lap-top and Noise absorber but the rooms show no sign of a womans touch and hence useful fittings such as mirrors were lacking
reviews.title: Pleasant & friendly hotel

likes.disliked: — Lack of mirror and drawer storage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The staff were all friendly and extremely helpful, paying great attention to details. It is a very personal service with help provided for tours and restaurants. The restaurants did not quite live up to expectations but we saw different parts of the City and could walk everywhere
reviews.title: Ten Stars!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone seems to say the same things - all good - so I'll keep this brief! Clean, quiet and charming small hotel in a great location. Nothing fancy but absolutely outstanding service. Fabrizio, the Proprietor, could not have been more helpful during our stay. The staff's help before and during the trip was literally on par with any Concierge Service at a 5 Star Hotel. For example, our hotel hair dryer overheated and before I could hang up the phone, Fabrizio was at the door with a new one. There's a nice little Happy Hour every night with wine and cheese and a very generous complimentary breakfast each morning. Our room was facing the street, which is a quiet one, but their insulated windows made it a cave - no noise whatsoever. Smallish bathroom, simple rooms but absolutely immaculate. Florence is small but this location was very central but not next to a million leather jacket stores. We would stay here again in a minute.
reviews.title: Great Hospitality ni the Middle of Florence - GREAT LOCATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first trip to Europe and I was a bit nervous about the quality of hotels in the country. I'd been advised not to expect much.
reviews.title: They didn't miss a detail!

likes.liked: — In room computer and internet access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I was so pleased with Hotel Davanzati! The hotel was in a perfect location for walking to all the major sights. Our room was equipped with all the amenities one could want... a comfortable bed, fully stocked bar, in-room laptop computer (with internet access), a spacious and nicely equipped bathroom, DVD player with current movies available, and even a white noise machine, should outside noises cause a bother. The room was very clean and well kept.
reviews.title: Great hotel - will be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff were friendly and helpful. I'd made a number of e-mail correspondences with the hotel and they were always prompt to answer questions. When I made my reservation, I requested that the hotel make reservations for the Accademia and Uffizi Gallery. Both reservations tickets were waiting when I arrived and were clearly arranged for times when one could best enjoy these museums, with the fewest crowds.
reviews.title: great location for seeing Florence, wonderful hospitality

likes.disliked: — the stairs, but we got used to them

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Personal touch, great location

likes.liked: — Friendly hotel owners, great location, services, free happy hour, clean room, price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Davanzati while in Florence on our honeymoon this past July. We booked all our Italy hotels after reading everyone's comments on Trip Advisor so we wanted to make sure to write our own comments to hopefully help others with their selection. This hotel was a great little family owned hotel, excellent service was provided to us every day and whenever needed by both Tomasso and his father and the best part is that they answer their email on a timely basis so they are very helpful in booking tours and giving travelers any information they require prior to their arrival. Also a little bonus part is that if you pay cash, they offer a 10% discount on the rates. Honestly, the hotel is situated in a great area within walking distance to all restaurants, sights and the train station. They have this great little happy hour from 5-7 (I think) where you can sample some great wines and bruschetta free of charge and they are very helpful in general with all requests. I would definitely recommend staying here for a great price and a great experience in Florence.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Surely the BEst hotel in FLorence for the price. Three generation of Owners-grandfather, father and son. The location is quiet and in the middle of everything, just steps away from all the florentine hsitorial sights and shopping!
reviews.title: BEST hotel in Florence-Davasati

likes.disliked: — there are stairs to walk up before you get the elevator-older people may not be able to climb the stairs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Fabrizio the owner made sure eveything was right, spoke great English and would help you with eveything. Free lap top nad internet nad breakfast ans well as a greeat happy hour. This is my new place to stay in FLorence form now on!!!
reviews.title: Love the Davanzati

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I honestly cannot think of a single negative thing to say about this hotel. Clean and comfortable rooms, each with its own laptop with internet connection,delicious breakfast, 'happy hour' in the evening, with free prosecco and bruschetta, ideal location, and friendly and helpful owners who are delighted to recommend sites, tours and restaurants (all of which were very good!) Florence is a beautiful city, and if you plan to visit, you should stay at this hotel!
reviews.title: Good, helpful, all around positive experience
Great value for money
reviews.text: Very helpful, accommodating, friendly and professional. I would stay there again without a second thought. Quieter side street is very good and it is about a 5 minute walk at most to the Piazza Signoria. For those with problems climbing stairs, there are about 22 steps up to the elevator.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful hotel. The rooms were very clean and big by european standards. The owner at our request had organised & prebooked a lot of trips for us which meant that we saw a lot of Florence in a short space of time. The hotel is in an excellent location and although we were overlooking the street the noise was not a problem.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008
reviews.text: Fabrizio (the owner) went well out of his way to find (& buy for us) a piece of equipment that we were looking for which saved us a lot of time and effort especially when we were supposed to be on holiday.
reviews.title: My favorite little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can't recommend this hotel enough as we definitely had a great holiday thanks to Fabrizio.
reviews.title: OMG - LOVED, LOVED, LOVED it!!!!

likes.liked: — The amazing service and wonderful accomodations
likes.disliked: — The climb up the stairs to get to the hotel - but it was not a big deal!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during out trip to Italy. We absolutely loved this hotel! The location is excellent being so close to all the major attractions. If you are planning on taking some tours... the ArtViva/Original Florence Walking Tours (a great tour company) is literally steps away from the front door of the hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in the heart of Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: When you arrive at the hotel, you have to climb a flight of stairs to get to the elevator (probably the only negative I can think of). There is a intercom that rings up to the front desk... they will send someone to greet you and help you with your bags. The front desk/lobby area is very inviting. Fabrizio greets you when you walk into the lobby. He is extremely helpful with booking tours and transportation, and can also help with restaurant suggestions.
reviews.title: loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I can highly recommend Hotel Davanzati. Fabrizio and family run a first class establishment. When we arrived our museum reservations which we requested were all set for us. Our room was great. Not too small by European standards. FREE laptop in the room- and if you have time for tv- there are lots of FREE movies in English available. Every evening at 630- they have a nice little candlelit happy hour with bruschetta. It's a great t ime to mingle with other guests and get some ideas, etc...The hotel is very clean. The location is 5 min from Duomo and in the heart of many shops. We never once needed a taxi. The price was very fair. The breakfast in the morning was great- fresh fruit, croissants...etc. I can highly recommend Hotel Davanzati to anyone. When I return to Florence- I will stay here.
reviews.title: Charming Hotel- Great Location and Hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from a 7 nights stay at the Davanzati Hotel , Via Porta Rossa 5 , in the heart of old Floreance . This is a ideally located hotel which offers a friendly , homely service and a perfect place to explore Florence . The staff is fantastic with a great homely feel ; you will never find a better host than Fabrizio or Tommaso . We also recommend to buy local trips in Toscany ( Siena is a must ) with a very kind help from the staff . Every evening between 6.30to7.30 is a '' happy hour '' in hotel , with italian vine and a good opportunity for guests to meet and to share experiences .
reviews.title: Excelent hotel , fantastic staff .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a good stay over three nights as part of a trip that included several cities in Italy and France. The Davanzati compared well with our other choices, with a room that was a bit roomier and had the added feature of a laptop in the room. Everything was clean and well kept. The breakfast was plentiful and tasty and the coffee was very good. The hotel does a happy hour which was a nice touch. We liked the location a lot- easy walk to shopping and good restaurants. Folks at the desk were helpful when we asked for restaurant suggestions and the like. On the down side, there is a flight of stairs before you get to the hotel elevator. Our room had a stepup bathroom which amounted to a minor annoyance. Some street noise did reach our room though it did not seem excessive. We would definitely return .
reviews.title: Good Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Davanzati Hotel and we were very pleased with the room, the location of the hotel, but most of all the service and friendliness we received from Fabrizio. He gave great recommendations for places to eat and was always willing to spend as much time as needed to answer any questions we had. We also loved the happy hour each night - and the candles are a really nice touch. A very warm feeling all in all from this hotel! Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Great Location and Great Hospitality!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the minute we arrived Tomas could not help us enough. He saved our visit to the Uffizi when the lines were two hours long he found us a tour and we walked right in. This hotel is a great find in a great location. Happy hour is fantastic - guests weet to share stories and experiences. Can't say enough great things.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Outstanding place, fabulous location and a great team. Its the perfect hotel to stay at in Florence. Highly recommend to anyone planning a visit.
reviews.title: Anniversary/Birthday celebration

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed as a single female traveller from oz in April 2008. It was easily my favourite hotel of my European tour, which included some 5 star hotels.
reviews.title: Favourite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think some reviewers have missed the point, - of course a 5 star hotel is going to be more "plush" and include a sense of luxury. However, what really makes this place special is the unique and special atmosphere that is created by the exceptional hospitality from the family that own and run the hotel. Fabrizio and Tommaso are truly wonderful hosts, who exhibit extra special hospitality.
reviews.title: It's a Gem

likes.liked: — accessibility to florence and cleanliness of hotel
likes.disliked: — small room and hearing people in the other room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I arrived particularly hot and bothered after dragging my luggage (I packed way too much) from the train station and was not in a good mood at all. However, this was instantly remedied with Tommaso's warm and genuine welcome.
reviews.title: Perfect Location; Solid Bang For The Buck

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Davanzati on September 14-16 and had a very enjoyable stay. Fabrizio and Tomaso are wonderful hosts and make you feel at home. They go out of their way to help you out with what ever you need. They took care of every thing including having our car parked, made our dinner reservations and helped us navigate through Florence. Loved the happy hour were you can meet other guest from all over the world. Good breakfast with great capuchinos.
reviews.title: A hotel with wonderful hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was some outside noise, but it did not bother us. The stairs can be a problem for some and for carrying up luggage, but they will help you carry them in and out.
reviews.title: Best Service in Italy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Location is perfect for visiting the heart of Florence.
reviews.title: Forget this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely stay here again next time we visit Florence.
reviews.title: We can't wait to stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We highly recommend this hotel run by father son combo who are like friends now and helped us with everything we needed in Florence as well as rental car and hotels outside of Florence. We stayed in a spacious room with private terrace patio. After our stay in Rome, the outside noise was minimal. Previous reviewers missed ingenious white noise machine provided in the room.
reviews.title: bello Firenze

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007
reviews.text: The service at this place could not be better. The hotel is run by 3 generations of owners. Fabrizio, his father, and his son Tomasso could not be more gracious hosts. They secured museum tickets and rail tickets for us in advance so that we didn't have to wait in any lines. Their English is impeccable, and they could not have been more helpful. We were travelling with our children, and it is rare to find a reasonably priced two bedroom units, particularly with air conditioning. We loved all of the amenities, particularly the wine hour with music and candles, the breakfast, A/C, free internet access with PC's in the rooms (we were a little homesick), and the terraces off of the rooms were a nice touch. We had only planned to stay one night, but decided to spend an extra night. We were overwhelmed when we left for the train station, we had forgotten to pick up our passports. Fabrizio noticed this and ran down to the train station to bring them to us. The service really is as good as it gets. Don't even think of staying any place else.
reviews.title: Warm service and cool A/C in the Heart of Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Absolutely perfect in everyway. The exceptionally warm and helpful greeting when you walk into the hotel sets the tone for the stay - you could not ask for more. The rooms are spotless as well as the entire hotel. The additional services such as computers and DVD players in the room set this apart. The staff is more than willing to help with any travel plans or questions. This is a true gem. I highly recommend this hotel with its perfect location to anyone travelling to Florence. It is a must stay hotel. Thank you to the staff. It was a highlight of our trip.
reviews.title: Superb!

likes.liked: — Attention to detail and the exceptional staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is family run. In many cases, that's not a plus, but here it delivers in spades. Tom made us feel welcome from the moment we walked in the door. The rooms are comfortable and attractive. The public areas are nice. The evening wine reception is a delight. And Tom was terrific in handling all of our reservations (restaurants, museums, etc). It made our first visit to Florence an effortless joy. Easily one of the best values of any hotel we've stayed in Europe!
reviews.title: A family affair

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the Hotel Davanzati. My husband and I stayed there for two nights and had a great time. The hotel is small but very modern. Fabrizio was exceptional, always willing to help with reservations and suggestions. We really enjoyed the family feeling of the hotel. The location is excellent, walking distance to most things.
reviews.title: warm, welcoming and wonderful

likes.liked: — The owner, the location and the service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: There is a flight of steep narrow stairs to access the elevator, this might be of concern to someone with difficulty walking, but otherwise worth it.
reviews.title: The ideal family run hotel in Florence
Warm & inviting!!!
reviews.text: We booked Hotel Davanzati for our 3 night stay in Florence and were not disappointed. The room is comfortable and elegant yet up to date with wifi, flat screen TV & even video games. The location is superb!

reviews.title: Exceeded expectations set by even the best of reviews
reviews.text: This small hotel is well-run by the gracious Fabrizio. He throws a nightly happy hour with complimentary Prosecco, Chianti & cheese. He also provided us with great restaurant recommendations and helped plan our day trips.

reviews.title: great experience
reviews.text: We recommend this hotel!!!

reviews.title: Great hotel!
reviews.text: I chose the hotel by its exceptional reviews here and by it's location and... our experience exceeded all these very high expectations. Fabrizio was wonderful in recommending restaurants, making reservations (for tours and dinners), and setting up priorities for our mere 3 days in Florence. He and Tommaso (as well as other family members, in the breakfast room) tended to every concern of ours (room too hot or too cold, DVD is scratched, where can we take emergency-case passport photos...). Our room was spacious and comfortable. And, the extra special perk was that our room was equipped with a laptop, all set-up for internet access (which saved us the hassle of adjusting out laptop, yet again, to the whims of yet another hotel system). And I did not yet mention the perfect location?! Enjoy!

reviews.title: Wonderful experience at the Hotel Davanzati
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in November 2008 and were very satisfied. Fabrizio, Tommaso and staff were super friendly and very proficient in English and French. This is a very good hotel given its location and price. There are quite a few steps to get to the elevator, but they do provide help with carrying the luggage. Will definitely go back again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed with Fabrizio and Tommaso at Hotel Davanzati twice now, each time at the end of a DIY rambling Tuscan experience. Each time has been over-the-top for my husband and me. Fabrizio nad Tommaso go out of their way to make you feel like you're coming home to family!
reviews.title: The Davanzati is divine!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is well located, immaculate and equipped with the latest technology including in-room laptop computers with DVD players. The staff knows Florence and knows what travelers value. They are attentive to every need, from making restaurant and museum recommendations and reservations to hirng and getting us into an early cab to meet an early flight.
reviews.title: Great hotel in great location!

likes.disliked: — We liked everything. But older people or people with disabilities should be aware of steps leading to the elevator.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's a nightly happy hour at the Davanzati with candlelight, lively music and light hors d'oeuvres (recipe included). It's fun to meet and talk with other travelers to compare notes at the end of the day and get new ideas for the next day.
reviews.title: A Litle Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We are happily retired Floridians who will stay at the Davanzati again and again, and heartily recommend it to other travelers to Florence.
reviews.title: a tremendous and personalised welcome- fabulous location

likes.liked: — the staff were splendid- happy hour a really sociable idea
likes.disliked: — the sofa bed in the suite was a bit hard- small price to pay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Davanzati for six days and found it very clean, comfortable, and in the great location of Venice. Our room had a laptop and free Internet access. It worked great for us since it helped us to stay in touch with our family in US and also book next travel arrangements in Europe.
reviews.title: lives up to it's reputation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Davanzati in Florence for 11 nights in August/September 2008. We chose it because it was #1 on TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed. It is a wonderful hotel and I would recommend it to anyone. Can't wait to return.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel - we loved everything about it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As many other reviewers have pointed out, it isn't 5 star luxury - it is the amazing service that makes this charming family-run hotel so special.
reviews.title: Home Away from Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We staying in a basic double room rather than a suite, and it was perfect for our needs. The room was large, it had a very comfortable king-sized bed, plenty of storage space, free wi-fi and use of a laptop, functioning air conditioning and it was spotlessly clean. They even provide a noise-muffling machine, although we never used it as the room was very quiet.
reviews.title: loved the service, HATED the smell

likes.disliked: — the smell of vomit and feces in my room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Breakfast was included in the room rate and was excellent - with a wide selection of breads, croissants and pastries, fresh fruit and fruit juice, ham and cheese. Good coffeee too. The hotel also provides DVDs and games (as well as a good selection of travel guides and books) for the use of guests, although we were so busy enjoying the city that we didn't make use of these.
reviews.title: Another wonderful stay at my favorite hotel

likes.liked: — Fabrizio and family, Happy Hour, free internet, comfortable beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very well located, 5 minutes walk to the main sights, but on a quiet road.
reviews.title: Good, but not excellent
Perfetto....
reviews.text: Surely this should be kept secret as nothing this good should be advertised too much ........Well this has to be the best option around for most people ......perfectly located within minutes of the centre, the Uffizzi and the Duomo. The hotel is very welcoming and Fabrizio and Tomasso make your stay very easy with all the useful information you could ask for . The rooms are perfect , the beds comfortable , Dvd , laptop and PS2 , the list is endless and then.........at 6.30 the lights are dimmed and happy hour commences where you are invited to join other guests to taste bruschetta with the hotel's own trademark sauce, prosecco and music .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: We have stayed in a few hotels around the world but this is one that will remain a very pleasant memory.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay in Florence

likes.liked: — The overall ambiance, the people running it and the location.
likes.disliked: — The one flight of stairs to come up to the other elevator. The lighting in the bathroom is not very good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Xx
reviews.title: Service, service, service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed here for 7 days this July and had a really great time! The rooms are simply decorated and clean and also equipped with hair dryer, double-paned windows,noise machine, hair dryer and a safe for valuables. I am sensitive to noise, but the noise machine they supplied really helped me to sleep well.
reviews.title: Best hotel in our trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hospitality was wonderful! Everyone at the hotel, especially Fabrizio and Tommaso were really gracious and helpful. The breakfast buffet was very nice and varied and to have a fresh cappuccino made for me every day by the lovely lady there was such a treat. They treated me like family, which was important for me since I was traveling on my own.
reviews.title: Favorite Hotel Ever
Enjoyed my time at the Hotel Davanzati
reviews.text: My daughter and myself stayed at the Hotel Davanzati in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: for four nights. The location was excellent- right in the middle of the central area where all the shops and restaurants are, it was also a very safe area. The staff were extremely helpful and suggested activities for us to pursue during our trip.The breakfast was nice- there was cereal, and croissants and fresh fruit juice and the staff were always very welcoming in the morning. Tomasso was always very cheerful and really helpful.I would definitely stay at this hotel again if i return to Florence.
reviews.title: Best for the money

likes.disliked: — Stairs up to the lift. Hotel check-in is on 2nd floor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I first stayed in this wonderful hotel right after it re-opened 5 years ago. The facilities were top notch and service was magnificent. I was so impressed with the owner and his family and the way they treated me (like family) that I decided to book them on my next trip, which was in July 2008. This time I had a group with me that required 4 singles and one double. They were absolutely delighted with my choice for them. One of our party suffered from extreme exhaustion while we were touring one of the museums and I took her back to the hotel for rest. Even though we had already checked out, Tommaso let her re-use her room for half a day and would not hear of our paying anything extra. All the kudos you have read about this hotel are true. If you can book them for your next trip, you should do it
reviews.title: Look No Further!

likes.liked: — Fabrizio, Tommaso, and the family at the Davanzati
likes.disliked: — 20 some stairs to walk up to the main lobby - small price to pay though!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: If you are staying in Florence, you can stop looking for a hotel, and immediately book your room at the Hotel Davanzati! There are not enough words for me to write in this review to describe how incredible our stay there was this past May. The hotel staff was outstanding! I didn't feel like I was staying at a hotel - I felt like I was staying with close friends. Fabrizio and Tommaso were available to help with any and every need and might just be the greatest hosts I have ever had in a hotel. Hotel Davanzati is perfectly located and is within a short walk of every major site and place you would want to be in Florence. Their restaurant recommendations were perfect and their directions around town were flawless. Do yourself a favor and stay at the Hotel Davanzati! I know we will be staying there every time we are in Florence.
reviews.title: Loved the Davanzati

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can only agree with all of the positive reviews about the Davanzati. I stayed at the Davanzati for two nights in July. I have visited Italy many times and staying at the Davanzati was a truly wonderful experience. Fabrizio welcomed me like an old friend, greeting me by my first name. Fabrizio and Tomasso are warm, friendly and charming. As requested, Fabrizio had arranged a voucher for the Uffizi so that I could collect the ticket the following day and save time queuing. Fabrizio informed me that the gallery was open until 10.00 pm that evening and I should try around 7.00 pm when it would not be busy. I went to the gallery at 8.00 pm and I almost had the gallery to myself.
reviews.title: Davanzati made our stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Without a doubt this is a perfect hotel. I can't fault it in anyway. Comfortable, clean, brilliant location and great attention to detail (internet access, DVDs available etc). Fabrizio (the owner) was ever helpful and truly charming. You really can't go wrong with this hotel.
reviews.title: Truly a wonderful hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Meliz
reviews.title: Why they are ranked # 1

likes.disliked: — Steps to the lobby- but we knew about it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed with Tommaso, Fabrizio, and family for two nights. What a great place. We really enjoyed the "happy hour" concept - it allowed us to meet fellow travelers. A lap-top in every room - you don't get that at the most "big name" hotels. Service outstanding from restaraunt recommendations to help with tours and taxis. We would absolutely stay there again. You can tell the "family" loves what they do. There's a lot to be said for staying in a hotel that is family-owned. We felt like we were staying in their home. Florence is a wonderful place to visit - and we were close to everything!
reviews.title: Staying with "Family"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Davanzati is in an excellent location, just 10-15 minutes walk from the station and very close to major attractions like the Duomo, Galleria dell'Accademia, Galleria degli Uffizi, etc. However, the excellent location is nothing compared to the service. Right from the moment we arrived we were completely looked after, excellent restaurant recommendations, museum reservations made, even free DVD rental when we wanted to escape the heat and crowds for a while. Our room was lovely, immaculately clean and very comfortable. When we return to Florence we would not even consider staying anywhere else. This hotel really deserves its number one position.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel; outstanding service, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Super hotel. Does not look like much from the outside but the inside has been newly and tastefully renovated. Room very comfortable, staff super friendly, location superb.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in the heart of Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: We LOVED Hotel Davanzati

likes.disliked: — Flight of stairs to walk up to get tp lobby (minor inconvenience)

reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic
reviews.text: We loved hotel Davanzati. It's close to everything, the rooms were great, breakfast was the best of any other hotel we stayed in during our vacation in Italy, but what made this hotel experience great for us was Fabrizio! Never have I had better service. He made sure every detail was explained and nothing left to chance. We stayed in a Deluxe Junior suite and it was great for two adults and two teenage kids (18 and 17, boy and a girl). Free laptop and Internet service in the room, air conditioned, flatscreen TVs in every room, 2 full baths with hot showers were great, very friendly staff and great service at breakfast. When we return to Florence we will stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can say no more than what others have said before me. Our stay was simply the best. The Davanzati is as close to perfect as you can get in an hotel. Thank you so much for a memorable stay.
reviews.title: Simply the Best

likes.liked: — Location, Staff, The Bed, Pillows, Happy Hour........everything
likes.disliked: — No tea making facilities in the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is AWESOME. The hotel we were at earlier that week had problems with the heat and hot h2o. We walked around the corner and they were able to accomodate us for 3 nights.
reviews.title: Fantastic!!! Miss it already!

likes.liked: — Happy Hour-very friendly-connected well with the local community for great restaurant suggestions

reviews.title: Firenze and Fabrizio
reviews.text: Happy hour is fantastic. We met some wonderful new friends during the happy hour and was able to enjoy Florence even more with new found friends.

reviews.title: It really is that good.....
reviews.text: The owers there are amazing, very accomodating and I would have paid more to stay there with all that they had to offer their guests.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great central location to walk to all the major sites (very near the main drag) BUT double almost sound prrof windows-bravo!, wonderful insight to local restaurant suggestions, good breakfast, very clean rooms, great beds-nice down comforter, and up to date options (free computer and internet in your room) how cool is that!
reviews.title: Wonderful in every way

likes.disliked: — All was good -- steps a bit hard for some to navigate perhaps.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a fantastic 3 nights in Florence at this lovely B&B. Fabrizo and his family (loved that dad was there wearing a tie!) were wonderful, welcoming hosts and the location cannot be beat. They helped us with everything from dinner reservations to suggestions on tours. Room was beautiful, clean and very quiet. Breakfast was very nice and we enjoyed every minute. We stayed her because a friend had been here recently and also highly recommended it as I am now.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay in Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A romatic stay in Florence. What could be better> We loved the hotel so much. The sheets were clean and fresh. The bathrooms were very large and great shower especially after warm weather. The staff is very friendly. Worth the price for sure.
reviews.title: We loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are just back from a stay at the Hotel Davanzati from September 22-25. It was easily the best place we stayed at while in Italy. No, it is not a luxury hotel, but for the average person looking for a great value in a great location, the Davanzati cannot be beaten. Fabrizio, the proprietor, was extraordinarily helpful to us, making reservations at the Uffizi and to see the statue of David, picked out wonderful restaurants, and made sure we had a taxi in time to make a 6:30 a.m. flight. The room was spacious, and even though the hotel was on a busy street, a combination of good windows and the air conditioning masked most of the street noise. In fact, we felt a little bit like we were in a cocoon at night. The happy hour was a very nice touch.
reviews.title: Great Service and Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is not perfect. There are the famous steps up to the elevator. But really, that's about it on the negative side from our perspective.
reviews.title: An absolute pleasure !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: All in all, I can only add to the raves from nearly all of the other reviewers. If you're going to Florence, you can't go wrong with the Davanzati
reviews.title: Nice, Happy, and Friendly, but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from our trip to Tuscany and stayed in Florence at this hotel for two days for his 50th birthday. I booked directly with the hotel and was e-mailed back promptly with confirmation. I found the hotel by searching the top-rated hotels on trip advisor and after reading all the great reviews decided this was the one for us. I had e-mailed about car rentals near the hotel and was advised that we would need an international drivers licence which we were unaware of. If it wasn't for the Davanzati e-mail telling us this, we would have not been able to drive as we found out one day before we left and ended up getting the licence done on our way to the airport from our local CAA office. What a helpful tip showing that this family goes beyond what the normal proprietor would even BEFORE you arrive!
reviews.title: A pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Fabrizio and his family were very accomodating and this hotel is located within walking distance of ALL sightseeing interests. We walked to the Uffizi, the Academia, the Ponte Vechia bridge, the Duomo, market, et cetera in this pedestrian only zone. Our car rental was right down the street within walking distance as well and we simply rolled our bags to the rental and booked our car.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel!
Fantastic experience
reviews.text: A small family run hotel, very clean and well run and rivals any of the larger ones. Our room overlooked a small courtyard and was quiet and comfortably furnished. A laptop is free of charge and in your room! Books, newspapers and travel magazines are available for the guests.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fabrizio was great with dinner recommendations as well. Also, there is a happy hour with complimentary drinks and snacks each evening. Highly recommend, you will not be disappointed. There are steps to go up to but they will carry your luggage up for you so don't let that be a deterrent. Lots of shopping as well! We will be returning!
reviews.title: Perfetto

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights in this fabulous hotel. From the very beginning, the staff ensured we had the best possible visit to Florence. They did everything you would expect...and more. They treated us like family. The kids loved the free laptop/internet in the room. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were lovely and clean. The free happy hour was so much fun!!
reviews.title: Great People, Great Location, Great Value.

likes.liked: — The friendly atmosphere of Fabrizio and staff.
likes.disliked: — It is not easily visible from the street.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were warmly greeted at the Davanzati and served well thoughout our 5 night stay. The room was very nicely appointed and quiet as we did not have a street-side room. We had a room that opened onto a patio. Our only window was in that door. but air-conditioning made this comfortable.
reviews.title: Super service and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friend had a birthday while we were there and when we returned to the room that evening their was a lovely bottle of wine and a birthday card!
reviews.title: Great find nad a true gem of a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a quick walk to everything we wanted to see in Florence and we felt comfortable stepping out even at night to the nearby restaurants.
reviews.title: Smelly towels, noise room, poor infrastructure overall – 2 star hotel at most

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot understand what Paul from Brazil can be talking about, take a look at all the other review I did before I booked and I am glad to say everything matched up to what was written and expected and more. Fabrizio is not only very accomodating he will advise, book tours in advance (which he did for us) recommend restaurants and indeed place the booking on our behalf. The room was lovely and so was the rroms of my other friends who stayed - all 5 of them. The breakfasts was very substantial with freshly brewed coffee and plenty of choice. The hotel is very quiet and you have all mod cons, laptops in every room, flat screen TV, complimentary toiletries and slippers, air con, shutters and a very comfortable large bed. The hotel is ideally situated in the centre of Florence and not too far from the train station. Whilst on vacation it was my birthday and I had suprise visits from friends which Fabrizio knew about and kept very quiet! we allmet at happy hour and had a wonderful time. I would highly recommend the Davanzati and I hope to return to the same hotel in the next year or two.
reviews.title: Terrific location and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have stayed 3 nights at Davanzati Hotel in Florence in September 2010. Completely DISAPPOINTED!
reviews.title: Excellent beds, excellent service, excellent location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have just returned from a 3-night stay in Florence, staying at the Hotel Davanzati. We've never added a review from previous trips but feel that it is deserved for the Davanzati.
reviews.title: Faultless Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Quite simply it can't be critisized.
reviews.title: Fabulous Florence Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Firstly it's location is perfect - a short walk from the station and bang in the heart of the city so all the attractions are within a short walk.
reviews.title: What a great find this hotel is!

likes.disliked: — one flight up from the street ...but you can buzz for help with luggage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Secondly the staff. Always available, always helpful and always more than happy to assist with any ticket, travel or restaurant bookings.
reviews.title: Delightful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Thirdly the rooms. Clean and comfortable and all with free laptop and internet connection.
reviews.title: Friendly oasis in centre of busy city

likes.liked: — The peace and quiet and efficiency of the staff
likes.disliked: — The steps to the entrance at the end of a long day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: This is a very sweet place. Just make it up the steep steps from the street and you'll be rewarded with a tasteful and refreshing hotel. Free wine at the happy hour, meet fellow travelers. We did for of us in the suite. A good value. Would def. one back.
reviews.title: A gem.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel was very well located for exploring Florence. It was one of the few places in Italy where we were able to get adjoining rooms for us and our kids (family of 5). It is close to shopping and restaurants. They booked our tickets to see David and our pizza cooking class. The hotel is in a very old building so it is interesting. It was clean but not fancy. It was fine for our needs and reasonable priced. Breakfast was limited but fine and the cappuccinos were great.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was a highly recommended hotel and it didn't disappoint. It's located in the heart of Florence and makes all sightseeing convenient. Right there near restaurants, shopping, the market, the churches, movie theater, the square....you can't ask for a better location while still preserving quiet as it's on a narrow street. The family that owns/runs the hotel (3 generations) are kind and personable and really want to help you make the most of your stay. They recommended an activity that we were thrilled to do....travel/tour in a Bentley Limo for 1.5 hours with Prosecco to a bluff overlooking the city while learning about this glorious city. It was thrilling. Yes, the tour company is part of the same family but it's fun, exciting, convenient, and the views were breathtaking. We got out there at the copy of David and took photos then walked to a bar and got another drink and toasted to this glorious city. The rooms and nicely sized, clean, and the happy hour at the hotel was a huge treat. We ran into people from our home town, Jacksonville, Florida! Free wine and appetizers along with a lovely breakfast each morning along with personable hosts....just wonderful. There are quite a few stairs to reach the lobby. You must consider this when making arrangements to stay.
reviews.title: A FULL SERVICE hotel in the heart of Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved the Davanzati. The hotel is in a great location. It is close to all of the sights the Uffizi the Accademia the Duomo etc. The staff is equally terrific.They were always available with help and advice reservations etc. There are steps not bad but one flight and then an elevator so that is something to keep in mind.
reviews.title: Great Service
Fantastic in all respects
reviews.text: This is a great place for a vacation in Florence. The hotel owners Fabrizio and his son Tomasso were incredibly friendly and helpful. They treated us like family. Their dinner recommendations were perfection. The location of the hotel is nothing short of spectacular. Nice touches included free happy hour Prosecco and snacks, a simple but excellent breakfast buffet, free wifi and laptops in all rooms. It was a wonderful place to start and end each day in this wonderful city. Make sure you review the Rick Steves episode on Florence. Rick's friend on the tour was Tomasso from the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hotel Davanzati is a traditional European hotel with spacious, comfortable guest rooms. They offer an early evening happy hour and breakfast. We found the staff to be extremely helpful regarding museum tickets, train schedules, and maps for our upcoming drive to Chianti. They were happy to store our luggage (and we had a lot in our group of 7) while we spend a few more hours enjoying Florence. The location is ideal, as it is near the Duomo and the leather market.
reviews.title: Staying in the heart of Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently returned from a 3 week trip in Italy, with 5 days in Florence in the middle. Our stay at Hotel Davanzati was truly wonderful! Our room was spacious, beautiful and very clean. We had a separate walk in closet which was a great feature. The room was a calm and quiet respite from the busy city, and we did spend a couple of hours there every day relaxing before a late dinner out. Very quiet and comfortable, despite all the activity at the height of tourist season!
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel Davanzati!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We enjoyed a glass of prosecco or wine (or two) and snacks each evening after tromping around Florence all day. Met some lovely fellow Canadians (Calgarians) who we enjoyed having a drink with!
reviews.title: Super Family Run Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was very nice with a good selection of yogurts, meat, cheese, buns and breads. Good cappuccino!
reviews.title: Super Helpful, Fabulous Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: The hotel is centrally located, within walking distance to Everything!! Palazzo Vecchio, Uffizi, Pitti Palace, Markets, high end shopping, the Arno river, etc., etc. Even if (when) you get lost in the maze of streets, you are never far from the hotel. Great location! The 26 steps to get into the hotel just makes it more cozy! (By the way, check out the Davanzati museum next door, worth a visit, though not always open!)
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I can only emphasise the glowing reviews already written. The location, service, comfort, attention to detail (special sound proofing glass fitted to windows and white noise machine), extras like free wifi, happy hour, ticket booking, make this a superb small hotel.
reviews.title: First class and recommended
Wonderful!!
reviews.text: We stayed here for only two nights while we were in Florence. The hotel is beautiful, great breakfast, and front desk staff were VERY helpful. It was very busy and only one person working the desk, but he took his time with everyone and made sure they were satisfied. Gave great recommendations and drew a map on how to get to certain destinations. Our room was very nice, cool and clean. We loved it! We did have a problem with our TV, but were too tired at the end of our day to watch TV or really care to complain to have it fixed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013
reviews.text: We stayed for 7 nights in August and thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The city reaches very high temperatures and our room was kept beautifully cool. The bed was very comfortable and the shower was great, with good water pressure.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was kept very clean and the service we received was brilliant. The happy hour is a lovely idea and the breakfast offered a good choice and provided an ideal start to the day.
reviews.title: A perfectly located gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another key benefit is the location - near all major sights and the train station, which was very useful for meeting tours and getting to and from the airport. We walked everywhere and there was a huge choice of restaurants nearby.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008
reviews.text: There is not a thing we didn't like about Hotel Davanzati. The location is fantastic and our room was clean and lovely (the laptop in the room was especially enjoyed). The staff was the best in all of the four hotels we stayed during our trip in Italy. Fabrizio went out of his way to make reservations and find exactly what we were looking for (small, romantic, outside, etc.). His insider hints of where to buy leather goods and to get a great view of Florence (the top of the department store that had a simple but delightful cafe was one) were things we would never had known about without his help. The stairs at the entrance were not a problem - even after being out walking all day - as it is not unusual in all of Italy to have to walk up stairs to reach many sites. The hotel was very helpful in carrying luggage and purchased good up and down for your convenience. We stayed for 3 nights and cannot wait for our next trip back.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel, staff and city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The highlight of our honeymoon was cominbg to Florence, arriving at the most welcoming hotel we have ever stayed at and being able to travel around Florence with such ease and always only a stones throw from the hotel due to its amazing location!!
reviews.title: Amazing!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived we felt like royalty in how we were greeted and treated all the way throughout our stay. The room was amazing and the first hotel suite ever that I have stayed in and could have slept all day without being disturbed due to the peacefulness of the hotel! We will most certainly be back and would now regard the hotel as our home away from home. Thank you so much to the people there who made us feel most welcome...it was the highlight of our honeymoon!
reviews.title: Its as good as the other reviews
Excellent Service, Location, and Ammenaties
reviews.text: Michele and Will

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Best hotel I've been to, best customer service I've had. Just two reflections; I've had hotels recommend restaurants before, but not particular dishes at them, and the recommendation was spot on. The early evening gathering was great – you end up chatting to the usually anonymous other guests. It doesn’t get better than this.
reviews.title: Awesome !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read the fine reviews for this hotel, we stayed there for three nights in August. This was one of those rare occasions when something not only meets lofty expectations, but exceeds them. The family-owned Davanzati is a true gem. From the moment we arrived --in mid-Happy Hour-- we were delighted by the hotel's warmth, friendliness and efficiency. Tommaso was a gracious host and gave us excellent suggestions for restaurants and tours. The room was very nicely appointed and even included a white noise machine to aid sleep. Bath and shower were modern and efficient. The hotel is spotless. The location is ideal...very short walk to the Duomo, Uffizi, Ponte Vecchio and the main piazzas. We could not have been happier with our choice of the Davanzati. I would also highly recommend the restaurant La Bussola a few steps away from the hotel. If there is fresher and better mozzarella outside of Campania I would be shocked. Bottom line, the Hotel Davanzati rules.
reviews.title: A true gem

likes.disliked: — Steps up to the hotel, but they're not that bad.

reviews.title: Fabulous, Friendly Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at the Davanzati the last weekend in August. From the greeting when we arrived to the help with getting to the train station and goodbye's when we left, it was a wonderful experience. The hotel public areas and rooms are lovely; breakfast is good; and happy hour is just the thing after a day of exploring Florence! However, the best part is the care you receive from Fabrizio and Tommaso from the moment you book the reservation and ask for touring help, to check in and out, to dinner and musuem reservations while you are there. It feels like you are staying at a friend's home where they are glad to see you and want you to love their home and city!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is really nothing I can say that isn't already somewhere in the other 920 reviews!!! Except...everyone else is right. It was a truly wonderful experience! The hotel is perfectly located within short walking distance of the major sites. Getting to the hotel by car is a little challenging given the pedestrian-only streets. However, once we arrived, we were greeted and the car was parked for us.
reviews.title: #1 for a reason!

likes.liked: — The staff as well as high quality of room and hotel

reviews.title: Better Late Than Never
reviews.text: Fabrizio is the owner and host extraordinaire. He made it such an easy process to reserve a room, responded quickly to emails, made reservations for us at the museums as well as had great recommendations on where to eat. The room was wonderful....every detail attended to. Breakfast was tasty. Yet, it is the personal touch that Fabrizio, his family and the staff bring to the hotel that true makes it unique. We even got a picture with Fabrizio to remember the special occasion.....you don't do that at the chain hotels!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Tara and Kevin- Atlanta, GA
reviews.title: As it says on the Tin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's hard to imagine a better hotel experience than we had at the Davanzati. Extraordinarily friendly staff, good breakfasts, a lovely room, free wi-fi and an excellent shower! Throughout our stay we were made to feel very welcome by this lovely family - Tommaso's restaurant recommendations were perfect, and every evening they provided a drinks party to allow the guests to meet each other. The location couldn't be better and the prices are very reasonable. No wonder it's (currently, anyway) #1 Florence hotel on this website.
reviews.title: Fabulous, friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: A cheap short break with budget flights to Pisa and booked this hotel because of the tripadvisor reviews. Was not disappointed: it is worth six blobs. Very centrally located near the Via Tornabuoni for fashionable shops, the ponte vecchio and within easy walking distance of Uffizi. Lots of nice restaurants in the immediate area. The people running it are very helpful without being annoying. The room was a small double, but clean and quiet with an excellent large shower-room, that was also disabled friendly. Breakfast was rather what you would expect in Continental Europe: "Continental".
reviews.title: Le ginocchia dell'ape.

likes.liked: — The service by the owners and standard of accommodation.
likes.disliked: — The breakfast lacked a little variety.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008
reviews.text: The highspot was the 6.30 happy hour. In the dining room they dim the lights, played retro Euro disco music and served free chianti and prosecco with nuts, bread and a delicious salsa dip. The other guests gently sipped their wine and discussed the finer points of renaissance art, while I tested the depth of this largesse by going back, several times, for more. A very happy Happy Hour.
reviews.title: Friendly and well run hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: An ideal place for families with small kids - central, rooms with "two halves" that enable you to have you kids with you, and a father-and-son team running the hotel who cannot do enough to make your stay fantastic. Highly highly highly recommended,
reviews.title: Superb family-run & family-friendly hotel RIGHT in the middle of Florence.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We (family of 4) had a suite room here for 2 nights in early August. The room had a king bed and the staff put in 2 very nice single beds where the sofa would have been. Quality of beds appointments and bathroom were all great. We also had a little roof top patio. If Italy was not in a heat wave when we were there we would have used it. AC worked great. Breakfast was a nice continental with great coffee. They also have a free happy hour during the apertif time with light snacks and wine each evening. Staff is there 24 hours and were very helpful with all requests. Location is great. Easy walk to anything in downtown Florence and the bridge and the shopping street equal to the magnificent mile in Chicago but on a quiet side street. We slept very well. One of the reasons Italians are in great shape is because if the number of stairs they climb in these older buildings. There is a small elevator which was helpful to get the suitcases up. But after that I think it was 50 steps -not consecutive- from street level to our hotel room. They advise you that you need to come up stairs to get to the lobby before completing your reservation. It was fine for our family but jic you have anyone with mobility issues in your group this might not be the best hotel for you. It was well worth the effort to access the beautiful room and made us feel less guilty about all of the great gelato we were eating:)
reviews.title: Lovely Family Hotel in a Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Davanzati is definitely a 5 diamond hotel. In the center of Florence, the staff, rooms, and atmosphere are absolutely fabulous. The daily happy hour in the lobby area invites guest to mingle, share stories, tips, etc. My husband and I met a lot of nice people from all over Europe and the US. The rooms are comfortable, and a laptop is availible at no cost. The owners go out of their way to make sure you visit to Florence is the best. Skip the chain hotels, stay here!
reviews.title: A Warm Welcome in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: This place is above and beyond a 3 star
reviews.title: Bang for the buck!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes there is 26 stairs to climb w suitcases but well worth it
reviews.title: Earns the high rating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My sister and I stayed at the Hotel Davanzati for 4 nights this November. This is my 2nd stay at the hotel this year. My time here previously was wonderful and I knew Hotel Davanzati wouldn't fail me a second time, which it didn't. Our reservations were made directly with the hotel and I received a prompt confirmation on on my dates (we were even put in the same room I stayed in previously, which was nice). The room is nice sized with two beds and a computer with internet access. The staff gave us wonderful recommendations for lunch and dinner, even making reservations for us. Breakfast was a very nice simple Italian breakfast which offered "American" coffee for those that preferred it. Happy hour from 6:30 to 7:30pm is a great time to mingle and enjoy a pre-dinner drink. It was a nice touch to a wonderful stay. The hotel is located in a nice street minutes from all sites. I look forward to my third trip to this hotel. Thank you Hotel Davanzati for making our stay in Florence so memorable.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay-Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Davanzati is as good as a 3 star can be! Family-run, with a good breakfast, free laptop in every room, excellent service at the desk offering great suggestions for restaurants, sightseeing, travel options. Clean rooms. Large and super clean bathroom. Central location within walking distance of all top sights. And a free cocktail hour every evening (wine or prosecco) for guests to mingle.
reviews.title: Outstanding 3 star hotel in central location

likes.liked: — Central location and laptop in room
likes.disliked: — 26 steps from street level to elevator level

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at. We had actually come from a hotel that didn't meet our expectations and were forced to switch to a new one our first day. This place was recommended to me, and we were fortunate to book a room that same day.
reviews.title: The Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are huge, especially for Italy. They include a laptop with unlimited internet, a living room, two flat screen TVs, and a spotless room that looks brand new. The hotel stay includes a Happy Hour with free wine and food for an hour. It's a very social atmosphere where we were able to meet other guests. Not only is the hotel helpful, but they actually care and get to know you. One of the highlights of my trip to Northern Italy. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Florence.
reviews.title: Davanzati gem of a hotel in a gem of a city

likes.liked: — Owners of hotel, location, quality of bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel based on the praise it received on this website and the advance praise (believe it or not) did not do it justice. I have traveled to Italy many times, visited Florence several times and this hotel surpassed all of my previous experiences. The only regret my wife and I had regarding Hotel Davanzati is that we were only staying 3 nights.
reviews.title: Truly Deserves Number 1

likes.liked: — So much... Happy hour is good.
likes.disliked: — There is nothing that I didn't like

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great stay of six nights. The hotel gave us great value, a great location and great service, including making museum reservations before we arrived. The helpful, courteous staff did everything we asked. The "Happy Hour" gave us the opportunity to meet other guests and share experiences. No question, our hotel for our next visit to Florence.
reviews.title: We will return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lily and Alf
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!

likes.liked: — The personal attention given to the hotel guests by the owners.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Winnipeg, Canada
reviews.title: The BEST Hotel in the WORLD - 5* service

likes.liked: — Warm, freindly service and homely feel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a wonderful little hotel in the heart of Florence. It is close to the major attractions and the rooms are a good size, very clean and well appointed. But the best part of this hotel is the hospitality. The hotel is run by a family that takes great pride in the experience they offer to their guests. They gave us great recommendations for restaurants and sights -- indeed, they almost never let us walk by without offering us an idea for something to do or eat. This hotel, while not inexpensive, is still less than many of the larger properties, and offers unmatched service. I would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Hospitaliano

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We arrived at the Hotel from the UK for our Honeymoon, staying for 3 nights. I chose this hotel because of Trip Advisor reviews. This Hotel is truly a hidden Gem. If you didn't know about it you wouldn't see it. You go up a flight of stairs, with Hotel Rooms on 3 floors. The Hotel is owned and run by a lovely family. The Hotel is listed as 3* but my experience was 5* - My wife has stayed in 5* Hotels e.g. Inter Continental and she said this hotel was the BEST !!!
reviews.title: Really Excellent

description: The hotel is situated in an ancient (1400) typical Florentine building, right next to the Museo of Palazzo Davanzati, in Florence historical center. After very accurate restoration, Davanzati Hotel opens its rooms once again: with original Tuscan furnishing and with all the comforts. The hotel counts 21 rooms: 14 doubles, 4 single rooms, 3 suites equipped with: Air conditioning, Minibar, Sat - TV, Built-in safe, Telephone, High speed Internet connection. Also in the lobby/reception and the breakfast room (which are hot spots with free wireless internet access), there are 2 computers for free use always connected to the web.
